title.narrative:
Enhancing local capacities to respond to the needs of the most vulnerable children at risk through specialized child marriage prevention and response services
Total population affected :1764 (women, children and men) , including 846 girls and boys Geographical coverage: North of Lebanon Tripoli and Akkar.

description.narrative:
The Danish Refugee Council (DRC) proposes a 12-month intervention in North Lebanon (Akkar and T5) designed to build the technical capacities of a civil society organization (CSO)- Akkarouna- to deliver gender-based violence (GBV) prevention and response services to children at risk. DRC will build the capacity of Akkarouna to provide GBV case management to a caseload of low to medium risk cases, while referring high risk cases to complementary DRC projects. Girls, will receive access to a full package of services in Akkarouna’s safe space, including: counseling and consultation, emotional support groups (ESG), legal counseling, FPSS. In parallel, DRC will directly provide legal representation to eligible individuals engaged in case management. DRC will also manage the high risk cases referred by Akkarouna staff after thorough Safe Identification and Referral training has been conducted by DRC. DRC will expand its existing strategic partnership and capacity building of Akkarouna in child protection (CP), oriented around case management and focused PSS (FPSS) on child labour, to undertake GBV activities such as FPSS with Adolescent girls and their caregivers around early child marriage, Emotional support Groups, and case management for low and medium risk GBV cases. in the North, leveraging its CP competencies to support children at risk.
The two organizations will undertake the aforementioned activities in accordance with the following division of responsibilities: DRC: Capacity building of Akkarouna in GBV core concepts and services and implementation of: case management for low and medium risk cases emotional support group activities focused psychosocial support (FPSS) awareness raising on GBV and child protection (CP) concepts and the ‘Community of Change’ network (please see Logical Framework for activity descriptions). (At least 5 staff will receive intensive capacity building on technical and operational topics) Provision of legal representation to beneficiaries referred to DRC by Akkarouna within the project. (10 individuals targeted) Support Akkarouna to facilitate referrals of high risk cases in need of case management to complementary DRC programmes that can provide this service Akkarouna GBV Prevention Activities: Awareness sessions on core GBV and other protection issues (320 target) Train community focal points to form a ‘Community of Change Network’ to deliver prevention activities, including: awareness sessions community events and locally-driven advocacy (400 target) Akkarouna GBV Response activities: FPSS for adolescent girls (216 target) FPSS for male caregivers (48 target) FPSS for female caregivers (90 target) FPSS for adolescent boys (120 target) Case management for low and medium risk cases and emotional support group activities (160 target).
